div.head: CHAP. CXI.
1 The Psalmist by his example inciteth others to praise God, for his glorious, 5 And gracious workes. 10 The feare of God breedeth true wisedome.
div.ab: Praise yee the Lord. I will praise the Lord with my whole heart: in the assembly of the vpright, and in the Congregation. Heb. Halleluiah.
The workes of the Lord are great: sought out of all them that haue pleasure therein.
His worke is honourable and glorious: and his righteousnesse endureth for euer.
Hee hath made his wonderfull works to be remembred: the Lord is gracious, and full of compassion.
He hath giuen meate vnto them that feare him: he will euer be mindfull of his couenant. Heb. pray.
He hath shewed his people the power of his workes: that he may giue them the heritage of the heathen.
The works of his hands are veritie and iudgment: all his commandements are sure.
They stand fast for euer and euer: and are done in trueth and vprightnes. Heb. are stablished.
He sent redemption vnto his people, hee hath commanded his couenant for euer: holy and reuerend is his Name.

The feare of the Lord is the beginning of wisedome, a good vnderstanding haue all they that doe his commandements: his praise endureth for euer. Iob.28.28 pro.1.7. & 9.10. eccles.1.16 , Or, good successe. , Heb. that doe them.
